answers.answer: I don't know what is causing your "problem", but after menopause the hair on the legs and sometimes the arms and armpits more often than not decreases or stops growing altogether.  That's the most likely cause.  But you'd have to talk with your doctor for an actual diagnosis.

I have the same condition. Mine is mostly below the knees and nothing on the toes. I thought it was from wearing slacks all the time or my diabetes. Someone said the other day that she had heard that if you don't have hair on your toes, you have poor circulation. I haven't been to the doctor lately so haven't had a chance to ask.

Thanks ladies for your input.  I should have supplied more info on my original post.  It can't be due to menopause because I had a total hysterectomy about 30 yrs. ago.  I also think my circulation to my legs is fine.I should have mentioned that I have a very underactive thyroid.  When I went off the medicine for it for a while, I lost all of my armpit hair.  Weird, huh?  But I am taking the medicine for it currently (Synthroid 200 mcg) so I don't think that is the cause.  I'm going in for blood work next week.  Maybe that will reveal the cause.  Sure hope so!Thanks again for your responses.  Terri

question: I hope this isn't the wrong forum, but I have no idea where to look for info.I'm a 57 year old woman,  5'7" & about 135 lbs. and in ok health.  The last time I shaved my legs (a month ago) was the last I've had of any hair on my legs.....even the parts I don't shave....my toes and upper thighs.  The only other noticeable symptom related to my legs going bald is all of my skin seems to have gotten extremely dry.Has anyone experienced or heard of anything like this?   Having no hair on my legs would have been great 30 years ago, but now it just seems so sudden and so strange.  Any info would be greatly appreciated!  Thanks, Terri
title: Sudden, Total Loss of Leg Hair - 57 yr old woman
